analyzed: nyar 'phos pa'i ngo la ni stobs chen ma dang / padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma la gter bsgrub pa'i don du'o //

analyzed: ston zla tha chungs la 'phos pa'i ngo la ni /

analyzed: nyar 'phos pa'i ngo la ni brtson chen ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' la 'jig rten gsum gyi gnas su bgrod par bya ba'i don du'o //

analyzed: 'di dag dbyar zla tha chungs la sogs pa'i zla ba bzhi po'i ngo brgyad po'i nyin par rnams la /

translated: and on the day of the passing of the sun into the sign of Capricorn,🔽one should enjoy the heroes and heroines of the speech wheel.

analyzed: phyed dag dang // bum par 'phos pa la bum pa'i nyin par phyed du byas ste //

original: nyin par brgyad po de rnams la /
analyzed: nyin par brgyad po de rnams la /
translated: On those eight days,

analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: one should enjoy the heroes and heroines of the mind wheel.

original: nyi ma brgyad po 'di rnams la ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: nyi ma brgyad po 'di rnams la ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas /
translated: On those eight days,

analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: one should enjoy the heroes and heroines of the speech wheel in the sequence explained.

original: de bzhin du nya khyi bar 'phos pa'i nyin par la nya khyi ba'i phyed dag dang / seng ger 'phos pa'i nyin par la seng ge'i phyed dag dang / bu mor 'phos pa'i nyin par rnams la bu mo'i phyed dag dang / srang du 'phos pa'i nyin par la srang gi phyed dag ste /

translated: and in the first half of the lion month, and in the first half of the woman month, and in the first half of the scales month.

analyzed: nyi ma brgyad po de rnams la ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas sku'i 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: In those eight days, one should enjoy the heroes and yoginis of the body cakra in the order explained.🔽By dividing those powers into three years, there are nine years.

translated: Having first taken up the worship of the syllable om,

translated: The root tantra called the Supreme Name of the Great Ocean is also taught in the ten thousand tantras and so on.

translated: The external solar year is also the same for each day.

analyzed: mtshan de ni dus kyi khyad par brgya phrag drug dang stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi dbugs ni /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi nyin mtshan nyid chu tshod kyi tshad do //

original: de dag gi nang gi ni nyin mtshan so so'i dbugs te /
analyzed: de dag gi nang gi ni nyin mtshan so so'i dbugs te /
translated: The internal is the breath of each day and night.

original: lus can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi'o //
translated: That is of embodied beings.

original: de lta bu'i chu tshod drug cu pa nyid brgya phrag gsum dang drug cu ni phyi rol gyi lo'i nyin mtshan gyi tshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chu tshod drug cu pa nyid brgya phrag gsum dang drug cu ni phyi rol gyi lo'i nyin mtshan gyi tshad do //
translated: Such a sixty-minute day, multiplied by three hundred and sixty, is the external year in terms of days and nights.

original: nang gi na drug cu drug cu pa sum brgya drug cu'i dbugs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi na drug cu drug cu pa sum brgya drug cu'i dbugs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The internal [year] is of the nature of the breath, with sixty sixty-minute days, making three thousand six hundred [breaths].

original: de dag 'di ltar zla ba'i ngo bo nyi shu rtsa gnyis la chu tshod dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar zla ba'i ngo bo nyi shu rtsa gnyis la chu tshod dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Thus, in terms of the external, there are nine hundred sixty-minute days in twenty-two lunar months.

original: nang gi yang de ltar dbugs kyi chu tshod dgu brgya dgu bya'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi yang de ltar dbugs kyi chu tshod dgu brgya dgu bya'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The internal [year] is also of the nature of nine hundred sixty-minute breaths.

analyzed: de dag 'di lta ste phyi rol gyi brgya phrag bco brgyad po rnams ni zla ba bcu gnyis so // phyi rol gyi sum brgya drug cu po ni /
translated: Thus, in terms of the external, eighteen hundred sixty-minute days make up twelve months.

original: chu tshod drug cu po phrag gsum brgya drug cu ste lo'i'o //
analyzed: chu tshod drug cu po phrag gsum brgya drug cu ste lo'i'o //
translated: In terms of the external, three hundred and sixty sixty-minute days make up one year.

original: nang gi ni dbugs kyi chu tshod drug cu pa phrag sum brgya drug cu pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi ni dbugs kyi chu tshod drug cu pa phrag sum brgya drug cu pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The internal [year] is of the nature of three hundred and sixty sixty-minute breaths.

analyzed: nang gi ni dbugs kyi chu tshod bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu bsdoms pa ste /

analyzed: dbugs kyi bdag nyid kyi chu tshod bzhi dang lnga dang drug pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of the four, five, and six watches of breath.

analyzed: phyi rol gyi chu tshod bdun phrag gnyis dang drug gi bdag nyid ni thun gsum mo //

analyzed: nang gi yang bdun phrag gnyis dang drug tu bsdoms pa ste /

original: dbugs kyi chu tshod bdun phrag gnyis dang drug pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi chu tshod bdun phrag gnyis dang drug pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of two, six, and seven sets of seven watches of breath.

original: phyi rol gyi stong phrag bcu dang de las gzhan pa'i brgyad brgya ni chu tshod kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi stong phrag bcu dang de las gzhan pa'i brgyad brgya ni chu tshod kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The external is the nature of ten thousand and eight hundred watches.

original: bgrod pa gnyis po so so re re'o //🔽nang gi yang stong phrag bcu po de las gzhan pa brgyad brgya ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gnyis po so so re re'o // nang gi yang stong phrag bcu po de las gzhan pa brgyad brgya ste /
translated: The two paths are each one.

original: dbugs kyi chu tshod kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dbugs kyi chu tshod kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The internal is the nature of ten thousand and eight hundred watches of breath.

original: de ltar nyin mo dang mtshan mos brgya phrag drug dang stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ni phyi rol gyi nyin mtshan so so'i chu tshod rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar nyin mo dang mtshan mos brgya phrag drug dang stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ni phyi rol gyi nyin mtshan so so'i chu tshod rnams so //
translated: Thus, the six hundred and twenty-one thousand [breaths] are the external hours of day and night.

original: nang gi yang lus can rnams kyi so so'i nyin mtshan gyis dbugs rnams te /
analyzed: nang gi yang lus can rnams kyi so so'i nyin mtshan gyis dbugs rnams te /
translated: The internal [hours] are the breaths of individual day and night of embodied beings.

original: 'dir ni mi rnams kyi lus po dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i bskyed bya rigs dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa can rnams kyi nyin mtshan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi rnams kyi lus po dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i bskyed bya rigs dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa can rnams kyi nyin mtshan gyi'o //
translated: Here, the day and night of humans are the breaths that produce the various types of bodies and shapes.

original: de lta bu ni 'dir dus kyi khyad par du mngon par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'dir dus kyi khyad par du mngon par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Such should be understood as the distinction of time here.

original: 'di rnams kyi zla ba gcig la yi dags rnams kyi nyin mtshan gcig go //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi zla ba gcig la yi dags rnams kyi nyin mtshan gcig go //
translated: One month of these [breaths] is one day and night of the hungry ghosts.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi lo gcig ni nor spyin rnams kyi lo drug cu tham par @213b 'du shes te /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi lo gcig ni nor spyin rnams kyi lo drug cu tham par @213b 'du shes te /
translated: One year of the demigods is considered sixty years of the Kubera [demigods].

original: sems can rnams kyi dbugs kyi 'khor lo bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbugs kyi 'khor lo bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of the wheel of breath of sentient beings.

original: lo dang nyin mtshan de lta bu'i bdag nyid gsungs shing bshad de /
analyzed: lo dang nyin mtshan de lta bu'i bdag nyid gsungs shing bshad de /
translated: The years and days and nights of such a nature are taught and explained.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: and the performance of the activities for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i dus kyi khyad par thams cad kyi nyin par so so bar khong du chud par bya ba rgyud de dang de las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dus kyi khyad par thams cad kyi nyin par so so bar khong du chud par bya ba rgyud de dang de las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed Lord has taught in this and that Tantra that all these special times should be understood as individual days.

original: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i rgyud du thob par ma gyur na yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i rgyud du thob par ma gyur na yang //
translated: Even if one has not obtained them in the Root Tantra,

original: 'khor lo sdom par gdan bzhi pa'i lha mo rnams kyis dus kyi bye brag shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo sdom par gdan bzhi pa'i lha mo rnams kyis dus kyi bye brag shes par bya ste /
translated: in the Cakrasamvara, the goddesses of the Caturpitha Tantra know the distinctions of time.

original: rgyud 'dir gsungs pa ni gnas la sogs par rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir gsungs pa ni gnas la sogs par rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of the yogis in the places and so forth, as taught in this Tantra,

original: longs spyod pa dang / thim pa dang 'jug pa rnams su mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod pa dang / thim pa dang 'jug pa rnams su mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: is to be understood by the wise as enjoyment, dissolution, and entry.

original: phyi dang nang gi dus su khyad par gyi mchod pa'i cho ga nges pa na'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dus su khyad par gyi mchod pa'i cho ga nges pa na'o //
translated: When the special worship rituals for the outer and inner times are ascertained,

original: de nas 'og gi gzhi dang / me dang / rlung dang / chu'i dbus su ri rab po //
analyzed: de nas 'og gi gzhi dang / me dang / rlung dang / chu'i dbus su ri rab po //
translated: then the foundation below, the fire, the wind, and the water are in the middle of Meru.

original: phyogs brgyad na mi'i thod pa chen po der shin tu drag pa'i dud pa can ni dur khrod chen po brgyad de /
analyzed: phyogs brgyad na mi'i thod pa chen po der shin tu drag pa'i dud pa can ni dur khrod chen po brgyad de /
translated: The eight great charnel grounds are the eight great human skulls in the eight directions, filled with very fierce smoke.

original: gsal shing gi rtse mor bskyon pa ni kha'i sgo ste khva gdong ma'o //
analyzed: gsal shing gi rtse mor bskyon pa ni kha'i sgo ste khva gdong ma'o //
translated: Impaled on the tip of a stake is the mouth door, which is Kākāsyā.

original: lhor ni ro tshogs ma ste /
analyzed: lhor ni ro tshogs ma ste /
translated: In the south is the corpse heap,

original: sna bug g-yas par ni 'ug pa'i gdong ma'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yas par ni 'ug pa'i gdong ma'o //
translated: which is the right nostril door, which is Uluka.

original: nub phyogs su ni dring ba can te /
analyzed: nub phyogs su ni dring ba can te /
translated: In the west is the fearful,

original: bshad ba'i sgor ni khyi gdong ma'o //
analyzed: bshad ba'i sgor ni khyi gdong ma'o //
translated: which is the anus door, which is Śvānaमुखी.

original: byang phyogs su nam 'jigs pa can te /
analyzed: byang phyogs su nam 'jigs pa can te /
translated: In the north is the fearful,

original: rna bug g-yon pa'i sgor ni phag gdong ma'o //
analyzed: rna bug g-yon pa'i sgor ni phag gdong ma'o //
translated: which is the left ear door, which is Śūkarमुखी.

original: 'di dag ni g-yas skor du bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni g-yas skor du bskor bar bya'o //
translated: These are to be arranged in a clockwise circle.

analyzed: de nas dbang ldan du ni byis pa spas pa ste / rna ba g-yon gyi sgor ni gshin rje mche ba can ma'o // rlung du ni sprul gyis zin pa ste /
translated: Then, in the northeast is the child’s corpse,🔽which is the left ear door, which is Yamāri.🔽In the east is the snake-bitten corpse,

original: rna ba g-yas pa'i sgor ni gshin rje pho nya mo'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa'i sgor ni gshin rje pho nya mo'o //
translated: which is the right ear door, which is Yamāntaka.

original: bden bral du ni drag tu 'thab pa ste /
analyzed: bden bral du ni drag tu 'thab pa ste /
translated: In the southeast is the corpse in a struggle,🔽which is the right eye door, which is Caṇḍālī.

original: mig g-yas par gshin rje mche ba gtsigs ma'o //🔽me mtshams su ni me lce gyen du 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: mig g-yas par gshin rje mche ba gtsigs ma'o // me mtshams su ni me lce gyen du 'bar ba ste /
translated: In the right eye is Yamini.🔽In the southeast is Jvalamalini.

original: mig g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje 'joms ma'o //
analyzed: mig g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje 'joms ma'o //
translated: In the left eye is Yamala.

original: rnal 'byor ma 'di dag g-yon skor du bskor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma 'di dag g-yon skor du bskor ro //
translated: These yoginis are arranged in a counterclockwise direction.

analyzed: de lta bur dur khrod chen po brgyad kyi rnal 'byor ma rim pa dang rim pa ma yin par g-yas skor dang g-yon skor du'o //
translated: Thus, the yoginis of the eight great charnel grounds are arranged in a clockwise and counterclockwise direction, in order and in reverse order.

original: 'khor lo 'dus pa ni 'di dag mchod pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'dus pa ni 'di dag mchod pa ni /
translated: The assembly of the wheel is worshipped in this way.

original: 'di ltar lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba rnams su ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams dang / kha'i sgo la sogs pa'i sgo brgyad por sgo skyong ma rnams la'o //

translated: Thus, in the navel, heart, throat, and head are the wheels of gnosis, mind, speech, and body, and at the eight doors, such as the mouth, are the door guardians.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug po @214a * //

analyzed: rnams kyi phyi dang nang gi gnas kyi bdag nyid rnams bstan to //
translated: are taught to be the nature of the inner and outer places.

translated: Now, the enjoyment, dissolution, engagement, and the all-pervading lord are explained.
